results.title: The Electronic telephone
results.brief_description: This short film is about telecommunications, silicon technology, and the E-phone and Bell’s role in its development. The E-phone is the world’s first fully electronic telephone. Chips utilized in it were designed by Bell Northern Research in Ottawa. Northern Telecom makes 256 phones an hour, on one production line alone. As Canada changes, the telephone changes with it and this film includes historical glimpses with a montage of shots from a telephone museum.

results.title: The Duties of a secretary
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the duties of a secretary and shows how they should be carried out to ensure maximum efficiency in the office. Shows correct and incorrect methods of handling a job, the wrong methods being demonstrated in a dream which a young secretary experiences on the eve of beginning a new job.

results.title: The Dresden Cross Choir in its hometown = Der Dresdener Kreushor in seiner heimatstadt
results.brief_description: The Dresden Choir consists of 80 young men and boys ranging from10-20 years old and has been in existence from 156 years. Shots of the city of Dresden are interspersed with those of the Choir singing in concerts, practising and relaxing.

results.title: The Discoverers
results.brief_description: A look at several scientific discoveries and techniques and their implications for the future of humanity - the laser, the fuel cell, urethane foam, the petrochemicals, cross-pollination of technologies, a jet piercing drill and micro-circuitry.

results.title: The Desperate heart
results.brief_description: A modern dance solo based on a poem by John Malcolm Brinner describing the loneliness and agony resulting from the loss of a lover. A variety of camera effects and double exposures, combined with the dancing and reading by Valerie Bettis, produces an interesting experiment in modern dance film. Created, spoken and performed by Valerie Bettis; original music by Bernando Segall.

results.title: The Dead mother = La Madre muerta [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Juanma Bajo Ulloa and Gasteizko Zinema
results.brief_description: A thief, a cold blooded murder, a child witness and a jealous girlfriend provide the scenario for this intense and evocative psycho-thriller by second-time director Juanma Bajo Ulloa (Butterfly wings = Alas de mariposa, 1991). The thief, Ismael (Karra Elejalde) is interrupted during a robbery when the woman of the house unexpectedly returns. Without any hesitation, Ismael proceeds to cold-bloodedly kill the woman and only as he makes his escape does he realise that the murder has been silently witnessed by the woman’s young daughter, Leire. Many years later Leire (Ana Alvarez) and Ismael’s paths cross. Terrified that he may be exposed by the truth, Ismael decides to kidnap Leire and hold her prisoner in his derelict squat, much to his girlfriend Maite’s (Lio) annoyance and frustration. Leire, however, having been traumatised by the witnessing of her mother’s murder, has grown up as a mute. As Ismael’s interest in Liere turns from fear to an almost obsessive attraction, Liere unwittingly finds herself becoming part of a complex and dangerous love triangle, which can only lead to a twisted and violent conclusion, particularly in light of Maite’s extreme jealousy towards Leire. A film of suspense and intrigue peppered with moments of dark humour and acted by a superb cast including Silvia Marso, Elena Irureta, Ramon Barea. Winner of many international film festival awards (Montreal, Stockholm, Sao Paulo etc) including Best Film, Best Director, Best Actress (Ana Alvarez) and Best Actor (Karra Elejalde). In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Cultural Revolution
results.creator_credit: Myra Roper and Melbourne State College. Media Production Centre
results.brief_description: The film contains footage of both city and Peasant Chinese during the Cultural Revolution beginning 1966. Gives some background to the movement and compares Mao’s comment that it was 70% good and 30% bad with a current Chinese assessment that it was a 10 year reversal of the Chinese socialist cause.

results.title: The Crown of Thorns Story
results.creator_credit: L Zann and Educational Information Service Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority
results.brief_description: This video presents the most up to date report on the Crown of Thorns available in Australia today. The documentary tells the story of the Crown of Thorns on the Great barrier Reef. It traces the history of the infestations and what is now known about the starfish with special emphasis on the research currently underway.

results.title: The Conquered desert: Libya
results.brief_description: The Libyan Arab Republic since the revolution of September 1969 has progressed in many ways. There has been a development of an infrastructure of industry and agriculture. There is education for all, cultural centres, housing and health services. In fact, total self-sufficiency has been achieved since the revolution.

results.title: The Commissar = Kimissar
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “In the town of Berdichev” by Vassily Grossman. In the Ukraine in 1920 during the Russian Civil War, a weary commissar (political officer) finds that she is pregnant. The home of a poor Jewish tinker and his family is requisitioned for her confinement. Mutual suspicion gives way to warmer emotions. The commissar and her new baby become part of his extended family. With flashbacks, a surrealistic dream sequence and grim fantasy, the simple story is given a wider perspective as a meditation on Jewish suffering.
